title: A Homestead Holiday
description: Molly and Liam could spend the holidays with sweet snuggles and cozy kisses by the woodstove fire… if they can get past their differences.Culinary teacher Molly Carrigan is gearing up for her annual student bake-off. But before she can taste her first pumpkin pie, bad news strikes. The school board has defunded culinary arts.Molly has two choices: teach a different class or find a job elsewhere.Despite their hurtful decision, the school means everything to Molly. Prairie Creek High is her second home, and her students are like her own children.She can’t just leave, can she?***Liam Granger looks forward to harvest season all year. Especially because his ranch boasts the biggest holiday festival north of Nebraska.But things have changed.Just weeks out from the big day, his dad dies. Now, all that Liam wants to do is grieve alone.After nearly letting their hard work go to waste, Liam realizes his father’s memory is at stake. The season of celebrations must go on. Besides, help is on the way in the form of the local school district and its new agriculture program.If Liam can train the kids, they’ll work the festival and relieve some of his burden.What the rugged rancher doesn’t expect, however, is having to train their teacher, too. Especially one who seems to hate him.Cuddle up with this heartwarming, enemies-to-lovers romance set in the coziest small town in America.
author: Elizabeth Bromke
